text: idk maybe i'm weird but spending most days inside slinging coffee makes you kinda indifferent to whether it’s sunny or snowing outside 🤷‍♀️
gloomy skies = coffee & screenplay brainstorming sesh for me!
sunset vibes do make it kinda priceless tbh
every time i think i’ve found some hidden spot downtown turns out everyone’s on instagram there already 😒 pretty sure those rocks have been tagged online too lol
oh there's this tiny diner near me with classic movie posters on every wall - kinda feels like stepping back in time each breakfast shift 🍳🎬
finding your tribe kinda shapes new homes too - you trade family dinners for friends who get your movie references n' server shift struggles!
kinda tough realizing there’s no permanent zipcode when you’re hustling non-stop…makes those little moments between shifts at your regular haunts feel like tiny anchors though 🌆
Home feels wherever i manage making rent almost 😂
oh man, ya think server life means just refilling cups but half our shift sometimes feels like dodging spoilers during award season – servers gotta binge too! 🍿
ever noticed how much hipster cafes overcharge for avocado toast? 🥑💸
everyone's suddenly future planning experts who've never heard of rent prices or student loans 🙄 kinda wild how one birthday party changes your convo topics from fav movies to mortgage rates...
privacy's nice but so overhyped when you've gotta hustle daily
not much better here - feels like social events always assume you're half of a pair 😒
city life solo = constantly third-wheelin’ at couple-dominated events 😒
